unnormalised: Firstly, those gene things are found on chromosomes, which are located in the nucleus of the cell. Each human has 23 pairs of chromosomes, meaning you have 46 total chromosomes in each cell of your body (with the exception of sex cells). This chromosomal arrangement carries the genetic code that governs human physiology. A karyotype test costs Rs. 3500 at SRL Diagnostics.
normalised: Firstly, those gene things are found on chromosomes, which are located in the nucleus of the cell. Each human has twenty three pairs of chromosomes, meaning you have forty six total chromosomes in each cell of your body (with the exception of sex cells). This chromosomal arrangement carries the genetic code that governs human physiology. A karyotype test costs rupee three thousand five hundred at S-R-L Diagnostics.

unnormalised: Now, you might think genetics is all about serious stuff like genetic diseases and inherited conditions. And yeah, it is. Things like Thalassemia (1 in 8 Indians are carriers!), Cystic Fibrosis and Huntington’s disease are no laughing matter. But let’s face it, most of the time it's more about figuring out who to blame for your bad habits. "Mom, it's in my genes I'm addicted to gulab jamun!" It's the ultimate get-out-of-jail-free card, right?

My dermatologist, Dr. Mehra at AIIMS, said that Male Pattern Baldness is usually inherited from the maternal side.

unnormalised: Genetics even plays a role in your tolerance to spices! Ever wonder why your friend can down a plate of mirchi bajji without batting an eyelid, while you're reaching for a glass of lassi after one bite? It could very well be a gene thing, inherited from your ancestors who braved the spiciest curries of Rajasthan. I read an article that certain genes make you less sensitive to capsaicin, the active ingredient in chilli peppers, so this could be true!

unnormalised: Genetic testing has become all the rage nowadays. You can spit into a tube and find out your ancestry, your risk for certain diseases, and even your potential for athletic prowess. Think you're secretly a long-lost Mughal prince? Want to know if you're predisposed to type 2 diabetes? There's a DNA test for that! Companies like Mapmygenome offer home testing kits, but your family doc might suggest the same.

unnormalised: But be warned, getting your genome sequenced can be a bit of a rollercoaster. You might find out things you never wanted to know. Like that you're 2% Neanderthal or that you're at a higher risk for developing Alzheimer's later in life. Ignorance is bliss, sometimes, right? A full genome sequence costs around $600 to $1000 in the US (₹ 50,000-₹ 83,000 approximately).
